data.text:
Detailed Solution

Download Solution PDF

The correct answer is Portuguese.

Important Points

Ghiyasuddin Mahmud Shah permitted the Portuguese to establish factories at Chittagong and Hooghly.

Ghiyasuddin and his Portuguese allies were defeated by Sher Shah Suri in 1538.

Hooghly (now Hugli) was founded by the Portuguese in 1537 following the decline of Satgaon, the mercantile capital of Lower Bengal.

Additional Information

In 1651, Hooghly was also the first English settlement in Lower Bengal.

Chinsurah was an important 17th-century settlement of the Dutch.
